title: QNAP QTS Web change_password Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of QNAP QTS. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.  
The specific flaw exists within the handling of the OLD_PASSWORD parameter provided to the change_password.cgi endpoint. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code under the context of root.
addtionnal_details: QNAP has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.qnap.com/en/security-advisory/nas-201712-15
timeline:
2017-10-09 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2017-12-20 - Coordinated public release of advisory
